article_title: Joan Rivers, queen of the red carpet, left out of Oscars “In Memoriam”
article_text:
Topics: 2015 Oscars, Academy Awards, in memoriam, Joan Rivers, Oscars, Entertainment News, News

Joan Rivers, undisputed queen of the red carpet, was conspicuously left out of the Oscars’ “In Memoriam” segment during Sunday’s awards ceremony for reasons that are…entirely unclear. This evening’s ceremony has already been painfully boring, and the Academy has already illustrated how totally tone deaf it is. But really?

Rivers reigned the awards ceremony up until her death last summer and didn’t make the cut. Gabriel García Márquez, a novelist with questionable (if any) ties to the Academy, was included. Obviously, Twitter noticed the discrepancy promptly:

Wait, was Joan Rivers really not paid tribute in the memoriam? Or did I miss? — Ginia Bellafante (@GiniaNYT) February 23, 2015

article_metadata.description: Okay, seriously, what the hell was the Academy thinking?
article_metadata.author: Jenny Kutner
